item.title: Workshop - Init Security Titans
item.description: Workshop to initialise, train and deploy the Jade Security Champions across the Jade Development Teams.

item.title: Workshop - Building Security Into Your Development Teams
item.description: Kim’s flagship Software Developer focussed training, this time at OWASP New Zealand Day conference.

item.title: Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description:
A three part book series focused on lifting the security knowledge of Software Developers, Engineers, and their teams, so that they can continuously deliver secure technical solutions on time and within budget, without nasty surprises.

First book is complete, second book is content complete and currently in technical review.

item.title: Christchurch Hacker Con
item.description:
The third CHCon:


A conference aiming to raise awareness and skill levels of information security within our community.

item.title: Workshop - Building Security Into Your Development Teams
item.description: Kim’s flagship Software Developer focussed training, this time at Christchurch Hacker Conference (CHCon).

item.title: Haroon Meer on Network Security
item.description: Haroon Meer talks with Kim Carter about network security on Software Engineering Radio.

item.title: Workshop - Web Developer Quiz Night
item.description: Attacking a set of carefully curated questions around info-sec, white hat, black hat, attack and defense.

item.title: Talk - The Art of Exploitation
item.description: At JS Remote Conf: Kim examines and demonstrates a collection of essential attacks, commonly used in the exploitation and demise of many individuals and organisations today.

item.title: Talk - The Art of Exploitation
item.description: At NZ.JS: Kim examines and demonstrates a collection of essential attacks, commonly used in the exploitation and demise of many individuals and organisations today.

item.title: Workshop - Windows Exploitation and Persistence with PowerShell
item.description: Kim will walk us through a collection of PowerShell delivery (RAM, not disk) techniques for a common reverse shellcode.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers - Intense
item.description: Kiwicon hands-on threat modelling, attack and defence strategy training for Web Developers wishing to understand their attackers better, stay ahead of them and create cost effective defence strategies.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Computer Science Students
item.description: This time for the students of University of Canterbury. An exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural, engineering and penetration testing perspective. Based on the content of volume 0 & 1 of Kim’s new book “Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers”. This time held at the University of Canterbury.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: Hackers On Planet Earth (HOPE) conference in New York City. An exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural, engineering and penetration testing perspective. Based on the content of volume 0 & 1 of Kim’s new book “Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers”.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: AusCERT hands-on threat modelling, attack and defence strategy training for Web Developers wishing to understand their attackers better, stay ahead of them and create cost effective defence strategies.

item.title: Workshop - Tools, Password Profiling, Brute Forcing
item.description: Kim will take ISIG through the collection of tools added and configured on his penetration testing machine used throughout his book series (Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers). Kim will then profile a well known celebrities password, creating a short-list, then (on-line) brute force their login. Come along, it’ll be fun.

item.title: Security Review, Penetration Testing
item.description:
You need to be sure that what your development team(s) are creating is going to withstand the onslaught of those tasked with breaking your deliverables, and stealing your customers data.

Your customers want to be certain that their personal data is secure. You need your product to stand-up to those that are going to attack it.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: Kiwicon hands-on threat modelling, attack and defence strategy training for Web Developers wishing to understand their attackers better, stay ahead of them and create cost effective defence strategies.

item.title: Talk - Password Profiling, Brute Forcing
item.description: Kim talks with his fellow Toastmasters about profiling peoples passwords and then brute forcing web applications with the shortlist of guessed passwords..

item.title: Talk - Infectious Media with Rubber Ducky
item.description: Kim talks with his fellow Toastmasters about the risks and countermeasures of luring targets to execute infectious media on their devices.

item.title: Talk - The Exploited & the Exploiters
item.description: Taking the perspective of the penetration tester hired in by the target to find the defects in their security defences before the cyber criminals do.

item.title: Talk - 0wn1ng The Web
item.description: At Functional Christchurch, due to popular demand. Taking the perspective of the penetration tester hired in by the target to find the defects in their security defences before the cyber criminals do.

item.title: Talk - 0wn1ng The Web
item.description: At Test Professionals Network Christchurch, due to popular demand. Taking the perspective of the penetration tester hired in by the target to find the defects in their security defences before the cyber criminals do.

item.title: Talk - 0wn1ng The Web
item.description: At CHCH.js Christchurch, due to popular demand. Taking the perspective of the penetration tester hired in by the target to find the defects in their security defences before the cyber criminals do.

item.title: Talk - 0wn1ng The Web
item.description: At WDCNZ: Kim discusses and demonstrates how JavaScript can be used for good and evil.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: At CampJS, Melbourne, Australia: Join Kim in the exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural perspective down to the zeros and ones. Also providing insights of how attackers of your systems think.

item.title: Up and Running with Kali Linux and Friends
item.description:
Redirects to legacy blog post.

In this article I’ll go over getting Kali Linux installed and set-up. I’ll go over a few of the packages in a low level of detail (due to the share number of them) that come out of the box. On top of that I’ll also go over a few programmes I like to install separately. In a subsequent article I’d like to continue with additional programmes that come with Kali Linux as there are just to many to cover in one go.
